Detailed Description

Represent one zip area (postal area) in the map.

That is a collection of zip code items that are located within the same zip area (e.g. "LUND"). So a zip-area is mainly a collection of zip-codes with the same postal code.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Default construcor, implemented to be as fast as possible.

This means that no attributes are (re-)setted!

virtual bool OldZipAreaItem::updateAttributesFromItem (  OldItem *  otherItem,
bool  sameMap = true
)  [virtual]
 

Virtual method that updates all attributes of item and, if any, its nodes and connections to the values of the other item.

This includes e.g. names, groups, entry restrictions, sign posts, speed limit and gfxdata. For more documentation see Item.h.

Parameters:
otherItem The item from which to get update values.
sameMap Default true meaning that the items are one and the same (same map), set to false if the items originates from different maps (e.g. underview and overview map)
Returns:
True if some attribute was updated for the item, false if not.

Reimplemented from OldItem.
